item.title: I Accepted the Challenge
item.description: Looking for a way to strengthen your testimony? Watch how these young women’s testimonies grew after accepted the family history temple challenge.

item.title: The youth of the Peru Santanita Stake answer Elder Bednar's challenge
item.description: The youth of the Peru Santanita stake accepted Elder Bednar's challenge and are receiving the promised blessings.

item.title: Luis and Henry Connecting Families Through Indexing
item.description: Listen to two young men from Peru, Luis and Henry, as they bear testimony of service through indexing.

item.title: YM Eagle Scout Project Indexing Family History Records
item.description: The story of how one young man caught the spirit of why indexing historical records is important and used it for his Eagle Scout service project.

item.title: See You On the Other Side - Shaun Canon
item.description: Shaun Canon sings "See You on the Other Side" about seeing our loved ones again after death. The gospel of Jesus Christ provides comfort by knowing that because of God's plan we can see our loved ones who have passed on to "the other side."

item.title: Something Divine - Brooke White
item.description: Brooke White sings “Something Divine” to remind us that we are all children of God who has given us talents and responsibilities. “Don’t give up until your work is done.”

item.title: The First Noel - Lexi Walker
item.description: Singing phenomenon Lexi Walker makes a Christmas classic, "The First Noel," sound brand new in this music video about the true light of Christmas, the Savior Jesus Christ.

item.title: Music Video: I'm Trying to Be Like Jesus – Emily Brown
item.description: Emily Brown arranged and performed this version of the Primary song “I’m Trying to Be like Jesus” exclusively for Mormon Channel. Just as she is sharing goodness with all of you, share this video with your friends to spread the light and the love.

item.title: Love Is Spoken Here - Jenny Oaks Baker
item.description: Musician Jenny Oaks Baker and her family share their talents in this arrangement of “Love is Spoken Here.” Love at home is happiness at home.

item.title: Godly Sorrow Leads to Repentance
item.description: A young woman learns the difference between worldly sorrow and godly sorrow. 2 Corinthians 7

item.title: Walk His Way
item.description: (Joshua 24:14-27) A song about choosing to walk in the ways of the Lord.

item.title: Funeral Service for President Boyd K. Packer
item.description: Funeral Service for President Boyd K. Packer

item.title: Remembering The Life of President Boyd K. Packer
item.description: A look back at the life and service of Boyd K. Packer, president of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles.

item.title: Funeral Service for Elder L. Tom Perry
item.description: Funeral Service for Elder L. Tom Perry

item.title: Remembering The Life of Elder L. Tom Perry
item.description: Remembering the life of Elder L. Tom Perry, an apostle of the Lord Jesus Christ.

item.title: Elder Oaks at Payson Temple Groundbreaking
item.description: At the groundbreaking of the Payson Utah Temple on Saturday, October 8, 2011, Elder Oaks shared the personal significance of the building of the Payson Utah Temple

item.title: President Monson Atlanta Temple
item.description: President Monson rededicated the Atlanta Georgia Temple and spoke to members about the light from the temple that also shines in the members.

item.title: President Eyring Dedicates New DI
item.description: President Eyring dedicates a new Deseret Industries location in Sugar House

item.title: Wholesome Recreation
item.description: “Just as honest toil gives rest its sweetness, wholesome recreation is the friend and steadying companion of work,” says Elder D. Todd Christofferson of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles.

item.title: Today's Family: Elder Andersen on Children
item.description: Elder Andersen speaks about the importance of having children.

item.title: Proclamation
item.description: Elder Ballard speaks about "The Family: A Proclamation to the World" and the importance of families.

item.title: His Timetable-Robert C. Oaks
item.description: His children. His plan. His timetable. #Patience

item.title: Real Growth
item.description: General authorities talk about the real growth of the Church.

item.title: President Uchtdorf - "A Teacher of God's Children"
item.description: President Uchtdorf gives an address about being a teacher of God's children.

item.title: To The Rescue Young Single Adults
item.description: Search and rescue efforts blessed the life of Michael Nielsen.

item.title: Elder Nelson Talks About Covenants
item.description: Making and keeping sacred covenants is a precious doctrine of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, according to prophets and apostles who lead the Church.

item.title: Blessings of Conference
item.description: Twice a year, modern-day prophets and apostles gather at the Conference Center in Salt Lake City, Utah, to speak the words of the Lord.

item.title: Remembering The Life of Elder L. Tom Perry
item.description: Remembering the life of Elder L. Tom Perry, an apostle of the Lord Jesus Christ.

item.title: President Packer Talks about Seventy (Part 3)
item.description: President Packer and members of the Seventy speak about keys of the priesthood and delegation (part 3).

item.title: President Packer Talks about Seventy (Part 2)
item.description: President Packer and members of the Seventy speak about keys of the priesthood and delegation (part 2).

item.title: President Packer Talks about Seventy Part 1
item.description: President Packer speaks about the evolution of the Seventy from the early Church until today (part 1).

item.title: Examples of Using Social Media for Good
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar shares examples of how social media can be used to testify of God the Eternal Father, His plan of happiness for His children, His Son, Jesus Christ, and the restoration of the gospel.

item.title: Sweep the Earth as with a Flood – Highlight
item.description: Highlights from Elder David A. Bednar's address at the BYU Education Week Devotional 2014.

item.title: The Dispensation in Which We Live
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar explains that the technologies we have been given in this dispensation — the long-awaited dispensation of the fullness of times — are for the hastening of the Lord's work.

item.title: Social Media Guidelines
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar discusses four guidelines to follow as we use social media to convey gospel messages.

item.title: An Apostolic Invitation
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar invites us to sweep the earth with authentic and edifying messages filled with righteousness and truth — to literally "sweep the earth as with a flood."

item.title: BYU Education Week Devotional 2014 - Elder David A. Bednar
item.description: At a BYU Education Week Devotional, Elder David A. Bednar explains that social media is a gift from the Lord that will allow us — as we use it properly — to further His work in remarkable ways.

item.title: Sweep the Earth as with a Flood
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar explains that social media is a gift from the Lord that will allow us — as we use it properly — to further His work in remarkable ways.

item.title: 100 Years of Seminary
item.description: "I’ve seen most of that 100 years,” President Boyd K. Packer of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles said, smiling, as he prepared to speak in a broadcast commemorating 100 years of seminary.

item.title: Elder Perry: Centerville Leadership Conference
item.description: “The priesthood of God is a power like nothing else on earth,” Elder L. Tom Perry of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles told a priesthood leadership conference.

item.title: Sandy Leadership Training: Let the Holy Spirit Guide
item.description: When leaders listen to and follow the Spirit, it will enable them to conduct meetings in the manner described in Doctrine and Covenants 46:2

item.title: Harold B. Lee: Documentary
item.description: A documentary of Harold B. Lee that demonstrates the obedience, humility, and trust required to carry out the Lord’s work.

item.title: Joseph Fielding Smith: Documentary
item.description: A documentary of Joseph Fielding Smith exemplifying a life devoted to serving Jesus Christ.

item.title: Spencer W. Kimball: Documentary
item.description: A documentary of Spencer W. Kimball about his mission of spreading the gospel to all the world.

item.title: Ezra Taft Benson: Documentary
item.description: A documentary about Ezra Taft Benson’s dedication and testimony in taking the Book of Mormon to the world.

item.title: Gordon B. Hinckley: Documentary
item.description: A documentary of Gordon B. Hinckley about his influence in expanding the gospel of Jesus Christ to the corners of the earth.

item.title: Howard W. Hunter: Documentary
item.description: A documentary about the life of Howard W. Hunter and his dedication of service and honor to God.

item.title: David O. McKay: Documentary
item.description: A documentary of David O. McKay about how to make each of us better people, and ultimately, more successful children of God.

item.title: George Albert Smith: Documentary
item.description: A documentary of George Albert Smith’s life in serving and testifying that Christ lives so all may be saved.

item.title: Wilford Woodruff: Documentary
item.description: A documentary of President Wilford Woodruff that portrays his strength in overcoming trials to fulfill his divine calling.

item.title: Brigham Young: Documentary
item.description: A documentary of the life and service of Brigham Young. The characteristics learned through his life proved invaluable in leading the Saints to the Salt Lake Valley.

item.title: Lorenzo Snow: Documentary
item.description: A documentary of the life of Lorenzo Snow. In doing the Lord’s will, Lorenzo Snow acted as a true instrument in the hands of the Lord.

item.title: Joseph F. Smith: Documentary
item.description: A documentary of Joseph F. Smith that demonstrates his commitment as a servant in the cause of truth.

item.title: John Taylor: Documentary
item.description: A documentary of the third President of the Church, John Taylor. His is a story of spiritual strength and endurance amid challenges and persecution.

category.title: Unto All the World: Travels of the Apostles
category.subtitle: Videos: 47

item.title: Unto All The World: Missionary Work in Brazil
item.description: Unto All The World: Missionary Work in Brazil

item.title: Unto All The World: Olivia's Story
item.description: Unto All The World: Olivia's Story

item.title: Unto All The World: The Gospel in Brazil
item.description: Unto All The World: The Gospel in Brazil

item.title: Unto All The World: VanHulst Family Story
item.description: VanHulst Family Story

item.title: Unto All The World: Despoina's Story
item.description: Unto All the World: Despoina's Story

item.title: Unto All The World: Noah's Story
item.description: Noah went to England for an education that he hoped would change his life. He never expected to find a faith that would change his eternity.

item.title: Unto All The World: Zhu-Ching Sun's Story
item.description: Through the diligent efforts of Senior Missionaries and visiting teachers, Sister Zhu-Ching Sun returns to activity deeply converted to living the Doctrine of Christ.

item.title: Unto All The World: The Gospel in Asia
item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Holland, of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles, shares with us how the Lord is hastening His work of salvation in beautiful Asia.

item.title: Unto All The World: Matthew Mok's Story
item.description: Years after his baptism, a serendipitous reunion with missionaries leads to the rescue of Brother Matthew Mok.

item.title: Unto All The World: The Gospel in Africa
item.description: Unto All The World: The Gospel in Africa

item.title: Unto All the World: Gladys Villamizar's Story
item.description: When missionaries met Gladys Villamizar in a Venezuelan marketplace, she invited them to come to her home and teach her the gospel. What they didn't know was that her son was their Mission President and she was not yet baptized.

item.title: Unto All the World: The Gospel in Venezuela
item.description: Faced with the loss of North American missionaries, Venezuelan priesthood leaders worked hard to fill their missions with youth from their own country. Elder Quentin L. Cook returns to Venezuela to find that a challenge has indeed become a blessing.

item.title: Unto All the World: The Gospel in Peru
item.description: In a country rich in tradition and cultural heritage, Elder Quentin L. Cook visits Peru to share a message of love, hope, and inspiration as members and missionaries work together to spread the gospel message.

item.title: Unto All the World: Amalia Rivas' Story
item.description: Faced with the loss of her leg through a tragic accident, Amalia Rivas of Lima, Peru, found peace and comfort in the Savior's Atonement through forgiveness and love. Now, she spends each Friday serving in the Lima Peru Temple.

item.title: Unto All the World: The Gospel in Russia
item.description: In 1985, President Ezra Taft Benson charged Elder Russell M. Nelson with a seemingly impossible task—open the doors of the Soviet Union to the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Unto All the World: The Gospel in Armenia
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson visits Armenia to open the very first stake in the country that, in A.D. 301, was the first to adopt Christianity as a nation.

item.title: Unto All the World: The Royal Family
item.description: Follow the brethren as they travel the world.

item.title: Unto All The World: From World's Fair to Worldwide
item.description: Follow the brethren as they travel the world.

item.title: Unto All the World: Finding the Gospel in Paradise
item.description: Follow the brethren as they travel the world.

item.title: Unto All the World: The Gospel in the South Pacific
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles shares his impressions of the strength, diversity and faithful of the saints in this most beautiful part of the Lord's vineyard.

item.title: Unto All the World: The Prodigal Son Returning
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles affirms his testimony of Heavenly Father's plan, as Paul Mandler shares his Prodigal son story of losing, then regaining his faith and testimony in the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Unto All the World: The Wan Family
item.description: Follow the brethren as they travel the world.

item.title: Unto All the World: The Asia North Area
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson shares his insight into the Asia North area as he returns over 60 years later.

item.title: Unto All the World: Mikina Watanabe's Story
item.description: God is our father and we are his children. He loves us and wants us to come home to him.

item.title: Unto All the World: Keietsu Maezawa's Story
item.description: Temple blessings are available to all of God's children, wherever they live.

item.title: Unto All the World: Essa's Story
item.description: It all starts with love, says Elder Russell M. Nelson about the service families perform in the temple for their own ancestors.

item.title: Unto All the World: Finding Peace in Temple Work
item.description: "It all starts with love," states Elder Russell M. Nelson of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles relative to the service families perform in the temple for their own ancestors.

item.title: Unto All the World: Putting "Family" Back into Family History
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson, along with Elder Allan F. Packer of the Seventy, teaches the importance of family history and temple work as members describe the inspiring process of taking their own family names to the temple.

item.title: Unto All the World: The Gonzalez Family
item.description: Elder Christofferson explains the blessings of the temple as Brother and Sister Gonzalez describe the path they took to reach the house of the Lord and receive these blessings.

item.title: Unto All the World: The Gospel in Central America
item.description: Drawing on his recent experiences in Central America, Elder Christofferson describes the growth of the gospel and the strength of the Church in this beautiful part of the world.

item.title: Unto All the World: The Rosales Family
item.description: Elder Christofferson discusses how temple marriage strengthens families as Brother and Sister Rosales share the blessings their temple marriage has brought to them.

item.title: Unto All the World: The Gospel in Asia
item.description: With an historic visit to the saints in Asia, Elder Dallin H. Oaks of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles, organized the very first stake of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Hyderabad, India.

item.title: Unto All the World: Priesthood Leadership Conferences
item.description: The pattern used for priesthood leadership conferences enables the apostles to meet with all of the stake presidencies and bishops approximately every four to five years.

item.title: Unto All the World: The Stone Cut Out of the Mountain
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles discusses the growth of the gospel in Sierra Leone and the miraculous process of organizing the 3000th stake of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Unto All The World: How Beautiful upon the Mountains
item.description: Out of great adversity and violent strife, the light of the gospel breaks forth in Sierra Leone. On December 2, 2012, Elder Jeffrey R. Holland organized the 3,000th stake of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in this West African nation.

item.title: Unto All the World: Eastern Europe Documentary
item.description: A short documentary on the ministry in Eastern Europe.

item.title: Carlos and Ludmilla's Story
item.description: Carlos and Ludmilla's Story.

item.title: Unto All the World: Mexico
item.description: This video provides an inspiring look at Elder Bednar's recent experiences in Mexico ministering, teaching and meeting with the people of Mexico.

item.title: Unto All the World: Emin's Story
item.description: Emin is an artist in St. Petersburg, Russia who struggled to capture on canvas feelings about God in his life. He was introduced to the Church and through studying the gospel, found the spirit helped him do so.

item.title: Unto All the World: Victor and Mónica's Story
item.description: When Victor and Mónica were married, Victor became less active. The Bishop called upon the ward council. Home teachers and Quorum leaders got involved. Recently, Victor, Mónica and their three children were sealed in the Temple.

item.title: Acting On Inspiration: Juan Mendoza
item.description: Through prayer, fasting, and faith, Juan makes a great change of heart and finds joy in the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: President Uchtdorf - Guatemala Youth Camp
item.description: In Guatemala, President Uchtdorf shows the love of the Savior by showing love—first of all—to children.

item.title: Showing Love in an Ancient Land
item.description: President Uchtdorf visits with children in Guatemala and talks about the prophet.

item.title: Elder Nelson Visits Kenya
item.description: Elder Nelson teaches that if families will follow the example and teachings of the Savior of the world, they are more likely to be happy, successful, and people of integrity.

item.title: Elder Nelson Ministers to Members in Madagascar
item.description: Elder Nelson met with members, missionaries, and leaders in Madagascar and Malawi and counseled them to learn of the Savior.

item.title: Elder Ballard Teaches Members in Mexico
item.description: Elder Ballard teaches Saints in Mexico about the importance of fast offerings.

item.title: Elder Andersen Ministers to Saints in Bolivia
item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles taught members, leaders, and missionaries during a series of meetings in Bolivia in August.

item.title: Is Faith in the Atonement of Jesus Christ Written upon our Hearts?
item.description: Quote given by Linda K. Burton at the General Relief Society Meeting held on September 29, 2012

item.title: Join Us for the General Women's Meeting
item.description: An invitation to all women ages eight and older to the general women’s meeting of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints on March 29, 2014, at 6:00 p.m. MDT. Come and hear inspiring messages of hope and guidance at gc.lds.org.

item.title: Engaged in This Work
item.description: A thought from Linda K. Burton, Relief Society general president, about the strength women bring to the work of salvation.

item.title: Different, Yet the Same
item.description: A thought from Rosemary M. Wixom, Primary general president, about the unity of women throughout the world.

item.title: Women in the Church
item.description: Sister Linda K. Burton, Sister Elaine S. Dalton and Sister Rosemary M. Wixom provide insights into their roles in Church leadership, describe the power of the priesthood in people's lives and provide answers to questions of interest.

item.title: Vision for Women's Organizations
item.description: Vision for Women's Organizations

item.title: General Women's Meeting Choir
item.description: General Women's Meeting Choir

item.title: Strength in Sisterhood
item.description: Strength in Sisterhood

item.title: Strengthening Home and Family
item.description: Strengthening Home and Family

item.title: LDS Women and Hastening the Work
item.description: LDS Women and Hastening the Work

item.title: Integrated Global Leadership Training
item.description: Integrated Global Leadership Training

item.title: Young Women General Board
item.description: Young Women General Board

item.title: Overview in Recent Developments in Women's Organizations
item.description: Overview in Recent Developments in Women's Organizations

item.title: Celebrating 170 Years of Relief Society
item.description: Julie B. Beck speaks in celebration of the work of the Relief Society over 170 years.

item.title: Relief Society - Daughters in My Kingdom
item.description: The Relief Society general presidency discusses the purpose of this book, how it can be used, why it is important in the lives of members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, and much more.

item.title: The Gift – Daughters in My Kingdom
item.description: Sister Julie B. Beck, Relief Society General President, encourages all to read and study "Daughters In My Kingdom: The History and Work of Relief Society."

item.title: This Is Visiting Teaching
item.description: Visiting teaching is more than just a calling.

item.title: Relief Society: An Enduring Legacy
item.description: Relief Society sisters share a glorious heritage of service and personal righteousness.

item.title: Relief Society: A Sacred Work
item.description: Ours is a work of salvation, service, and becoming a holy people.

item.title: 12 Steps to Change - Series Trailer
item.description: Introducing 12 Steps to Change, an original Mormon Channel video series highlighting the real struggles and triumphs of people who have overcome addiction.

item.title: I Accepted the Challenge
item.description: Looking for a way to strengthen your testimony? Watch how these young women’s testimonies grew after accepted the family history temple challenge.

item.title: The youth of the Peru Santanita Stake answer Elder Bednars challenge
item.description: The youth of the Peru Santanita stake accepted Elder Bednars challenge and are receiving the promised blessings.

item.title: Luis and Henry Connecting Families Through Indexing
item.description: Listen to two young men from Peru, Luis and Henry, as they bear testimony of service through indexing.

item.title: YM Eagle Scout Project Indexing Family History Records
item.description: The story of how one young man caught the spirit of why indexing historical records is important and used it for his Eagle Scout service project.
